API_Description: Sets the page boundaries (media, crop, bleed, trim, and art boxes) for the specified pages in the document.
API_Description_Reason: The method name 'setPageBoxes' suggests it is used to define or modify the page boundaries, which are commonly referred to as boxes in PDF terminology.
Returns_Reason: The method is likely used to modify the document's state without returning a value, as it sets properties rather than retrieving or creating an object.

nStart.description: The 0-based index of the first page to set the boxes for.
nStart.description_reason: Page operations typically require specifying a starting page index, and 'nStart' is a common parameter name for such purposes.
nStart.type_reason: Page indices are usually represented as numbers.

nEnd.description: The 0-based index of the last page to set the boxes for.
nEnd.description_reason: To define a range of pages, an ending index is needed, and 'nEnd' is a logical parameter name.
nEnd.type_reason: Page indices are usually represented as numbers.

cBox.description: The type of box to set. Valid values are: 'Media', 'Crop', 'Bleed', 'Trim', 'Art'.
cBox.description_reason: The method likely allows setting different types of page boxes, and specifying which box type is necessary.
cBox.type_reason: Box types are typically represented as strings.

aRect.description: An array of four numbers specifying the coordinates of the box in the format [ulx, uly, lrx, lry].
aRect.description_reason: Page boxes are defined by their bounding rectangle, which requires four coordinates.
aRect.type_reason: Coordinates are often represented as arrays of numbers.
